Laying to rules, Statutes, Ordinances and notification.THE SCHEDULE .3THE INDIAN INSTITUTES OF INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY(PUBLIC -PRIVATE PARTNERSHIP) ACT, 2017NO. 23 OF 2017[9th August, 2017.]An Act to declare certain Indian Institutes of Information Technology e stablished under public -privatepartnership as institutions of national importance, with a view to develop new knowledge ininformation technology and to provide manpower of global standards for the information technologyindustry and to provide for certai n other matters connected with such institutions or incidentalthereto.BE it enacted by Parliament in the Sixty -eighth Year of the Republic of India as follows: —CHAPTER I

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 1. Short title and commencement .—(1) This Act may be called the Indian Institutes of InformationTechnology (Public -private Partnership) Act, 2017.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (2) It shall come into force on such date1 as the Central Government may, by notification in theOfficial Gazette, appoint.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 2. Declaration of certain institutions as institutions of national importance .—Whereas the objects ofthe Institutes mentioned in the Schedule are such as to make them institutions of national importance, it ishereby declared that each such Institute is an institution of national importance.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 3. Definitions .—In this Act, unless the context otherwise requires, —

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (a) “appointed day ” means the date of establishment of the Institutes established undersub-section ( 2) of section 4;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (b) “Board ”, in relation to any Institute, means the Board of Governors referred to insub-section ( 1) of section 14;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (c) “Chairperson ” means the Chairperson of the Board appointed under sub -section ( 2) ofsection 14;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (d) “Co-ordination Forum ” means the Co -ordination Forum established under sub -section ( 1) ofsection 38;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (e) “Director ” means the Director of the Institute;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (f) “existing Institute ” means the Institute mentioned in column (3) of the Schedule;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (g) “industry partner ” means an individual, or a trust established under the Indian Trusts Act, 1882,(2 of 1882) or a company established under the Companies Act, 2013  (18 of 2013)  or society formedand registered under the S ocieties Registration Act, 1860  (21 of 1860 ) or a fi nancial institution or acombination of one or more of such industry partners;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (h) “Institute ” means any of the institutions mentioned in column (5) of the Schedule and suchother Institutes established under section 11;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (i) “notification ” means a notification published in the Official Gazette and the expression“notify ” shall be construed accordingly;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (j) “prescribed ” means prescribed by rules made under this Act;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (k) “public -private partnership” means such partnership under a scheme of th e CentralGovernment which provides for establishment of Institute involving collaboration between theCentral Government, the State Government and industry partners;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (l)  “Schedule ” means the Schedule to this Act;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (m) “Senate ”, in relation to any Institute, means the Senate thereof;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 1. 6th September, 2017 vide notification No. S.O. 2928(E) dated the 6 September, 2017, see Gazette of India, Extraordinary,Part II, sec. 3( ii).4

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (n) “Statutes ” and “Ordinances ”, in relation to any Institute, mean the Statutes and Ordinances ofthe Institute made under this Act.CHAPTER IITHE INSTITUTES

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 4. Incorporation of Institutes .—(1) On  and from the commencement of this Act, every existingInstitute, shall be a body corporate by the same name as mentioned in column ( 5) of the Schedule.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (2) On and from the appointed day, any other Institute of Information Technology as may beestablished under section 11 shall be a body corporate by such name as the Central Government may, bynotification, specify.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (3) Every existing Institute or any Institute established under sub -section ( 2) shall have perpetualsuccession and a common seal, with power, subject to the provisions of this Act, to acquire, hold anddispose of property, both movable and immovable, and to contract, and shall, by its name, sue or be sued .

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 5. Effect of incorporation of Institutes. —On and from the date of commencement  of this Act, —

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (a) any reference to any existing Institute in any contract or other instrument shall be deemed to bereference to the corresponding Institute mentioned in column (5) of the Schedule;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (b) all properties, movable and immovable, belonging to e very existing Institute shall vest in thecorresponding Institute mentioned in column (5) of the Schedule ;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (c) all rights, debts and other liabilities of every existing Institute shall be transferred to, and be therights and liabilities of, the corresponding Institute mentioned in column (5) of the Schedule;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (d) every person employed by any existing Institute, immedi ately before such commencement, shall holdhis office or service in the corresponding Institute mentioned in column (5) of the Schedule, with the sametenure, at the same remuneration and upon the same terms and conditions and with the same rights andprivileges as to pension, leave, gratuity, provident fund and other matters as he would have held the same ifthis Act had not been enacted and shall continue to do so unless and until his employment is terminated oruntil such tenure, remuneration and the ter ms and conditions are duly altered by the Statutes:Provided that if the alteration so made is not acceptable to such employee, his employment may beterminated by the Institute in accordance with the terms of the contract with the employee or, if noprovi sion is made therein in this behalf, on payment to him by the Institute of compensation equivalentto three months' remuneration in the case of permanent employees and one month's remuneration incase of other employees:Provided further that any reference , by whatever form of words, to the Director, Registrar and otherofficers of any existing Institute, in any law for the time being in force, or in any instrument or otherdocument, shall be deemed to be reference to the Director, Registrar and other offic ers of thecorresponding Institute mentioned in column (5) of the Schedule;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (e) every person pursuing, before the commencement of this Act, any academic or research course inany existing Institute, shall be deemed to have migrated and registered with the corresponding Institutementioned in column (5) of the Schedule, on such commencement at the same level of course in theInstitute from which such person migrated;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (f) all suits and other legal proceedings instituted or which could have been instituted by or against anexisting Institute, immediately before the commencement of this Act, shall be continued or instituted byor against the corresponding Institute mentioned in column (5) of the Schedule.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 6. Objects of Institute. —Every Institute shall have the following objectives, namely: —

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (a) to emerge amongst the foremost institutions in information technology and allied fields ofknowledge in the global context;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (b) to advance new knowledge and innovation in information technology and allied fields toempower the nation to the forefront in the global context;5

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (c) to develop competent and capable youth imbued with the spirit of innovation andentrepreneurship with the so cial and environmental orientation to meet the knowledge needs of thecountry and provide global leadership in information technology and allied fields;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (d) to promote and provide transparency of highest order in matters of admission, appointment tovariou s positions, academic evaluation, administration and finance.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 7. Powers and functions of Institute. —(1) Subject to the provisions of this Act, every Institute shallexercise the following powers and perform the following functions, namely: —

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (a) to provide instructions in such fields of knowledge relating to information technology andallied areas as the Institute may deem fit, for the advancement of learning and dissemination ofknowledge;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (b) to lead, organise and conduct research and innovation in informa tion technology and alliedfields of knowledge in such manner as the Institute may deem fit, including in collaboration or inassociation with any other Institute, educational institution, research organisation, body corporate orfinancial organisations at  national or global level;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (c) to hold examinations and grant degrees, diplomas and other academic distinctions or titles andto confer honorary degrees;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (d) to create academic, administrative, technical, ministerial and other posts under the Instituteother than the post of Director of the Institute and to make appointments thereto;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (e) to appoint persons working in any other Institute or educational institution or involved inresearch of significance in any industry as adjunct, guest or visiting faculty o f the Institute on suchterms and for such duration as the Institute may decide;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (f) to create administrative and other posts and to make appointments thereto on the basis ofcriteria as may be decided by the Board;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (g) to make provision for dissemination of knowledge emerging from research and for that purposeto enter into such arrangements, including consultancy and advisory services, with other institutions,industry, civil society or other organisations, as the Insti tute may deem necessary;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (h) to create a website, highlight all information not restricted to those related to students,admission, fee, administrative structure, policies including recruitment rules, faculty and non -facultyposts, annual reports and finan cial details including statement of account of the Institute;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (i) to determine, specify and receive payment of fees and other charges, as the Institute may deemfit, from students and any other person, institution or body corporate for instructions and oth erservices, including training, consultancy and advisory services, provided by the Institute;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (j) to deal with any property belonging to, or vested in, the Institute in such manner as the Institutemay deem fit for advancement of the objectives of the Ins titute:Provided that no land or other immovable property shall be disposed of by the Institute withoutthe prior approval of the concerned State Government and the Central Government;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (k) to receive gifts, grants, donations or benefactions from the Government and to receivebequests, donations and transfer of movable or immovable properties from testators, donors ortransferors, as the case may be;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (l) to co -operate with educational or other institutions in any part of the world having objectswholly or partly similar to those of the Institute by exchange of teachers and scholars and generally insuch manner as may be conducive to their common objects;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (m) to establish and maintain such infras tructure as may be necessary, incidental or conducive tothe attainment of the objectives of the Institute;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (n) to institute and award fellowships, scholarships, exhibitions, prizes and medals; and

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (o) to do all such things as may be necessary, incidental or conducive to the attainment of all orany of the objectives of the Institute.6

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (2) Subject to the provisions of this Act, every Institute may take up the following works, namely: —

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (a) supporting and col laborating with educational Institutes imparting technical or informationtechnology courses located in the zone or region;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (b) advising the State Governments and Union territory Administrations included in its zone inmatters of information technology and  other technological issues referred by them to the Institute foradvice.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 8. Institutes to be open to all races, creeds and classes .—(1) Every Institute shall be open to allcitizens irrespective of gender, caste, creed, disability, domicile, ethnicity, so cial or economicbackground.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (2) No bequest, donation or transfer of any property shall be accepted by any Institute which in theopinion of the Co -ordination Forum involves conditions or obligations opposed to the spirit and object ofthis section.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (3) Admissions to every programme of study in each Institute shall be based on merit assessedthrough transparent and reasonable criteria disclosed through its prospectus, prior to the commencementof the process of admission by such Institute:Provided that eve ry such Institute shall be a Central Educational Institution for the purposes of theCentral Educational Institutions (Reservation in Admission) Act, 2006  (5 of 2007) .

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 9. Teaching at Institute .—All teaching at each of the Institute shall be conducted by or  in the nameof the Institute in accordance with the Statutes and Ordinances made in this behalf.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 10. Institute to be a distinct legal entity not -for-profit . —(1) Every Institute shall be a not -for-profitlegal entity and no part of the surplus, if any, in  revenue of such Institute, after meeting all expenditure inregard to its operations under this Act, shall be invested for any purpose other than for the growth anddevelopment of such Institute or for conducting research therein.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (2) Every Institute shall strive to raise funds for creation of a corpus for self -sufficiency, sustainabilityand future development of the Institute.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 11. Establishment of Institute by Central Government, State Government and industrypartners. —(1) The State Government shall  identify at least one industry partner, and preferably three industrypartners, for collaboration and submit a proposal to the Central Government.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (2) The Central Government shall examine the proposal on the basis of such criteria, as may beprescribed, w hich shall include the following, namely: —

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (a) the investment of capital required for establishing the proposed Institute to be borne by theCentral Government, the concerned State Government and industry partners in the ratio 50:35:15 andrecurring expend iture, as may be considered necessary during the first five years of operation, to bemade available by the Central Government:Provided that the ratio of investment of capital required for establishing the proposed Institute inNorth Eastern States shall be 57.5:35:7.5;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (b) the expertise and standing of the industry partners proposed in sub -section ( 1) in the field ofinformation technology;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (c) the assessment of the capability, financial and other resources of industry partners to supportthe Institute;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (d) the suitability of adequate land, to the extent of fifty to hundred acres, to be provided by theState Government free of cost;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (e) the availability of, or the commitment of the State Government to make available, adequatephysical infrastructure namely , water, electricity, road connectivity and security, at the proposed site.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (3) The Central Government may, with the concurrence of the concerned  State Government, suggestmodifications, if any, to the proposal submitted to it under sub -section ( 1).7

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (4) Where a proposal submitted by the State Government under sub -section ( 1) is not  acceptable to theCentral Government, the Central Government shall communicate its decision to that State Government,specifying the reasons for such decision.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (5) The Central Government shall, on acceptance of the proposal with modifications, if any, undersub-section ( 3), enter into a memorandum of understanding or an agreement with the concerned StateGovernment and the industry partners for the establishment of the proposed Institute.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (6) The industry partner shall —

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (a) actively participate in the governance of the Institute within the overall framework;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (b) support  and facilitate joint research projects with the Indian Institutes of Information Technologyeither through funding, collaboration or in any other manner;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (c) depute experienced individuals as adjunct faculty;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (d) encourage, enable, support and mentor stud ents to do research project as a part of their coursecurriculum, within their enterprise;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (e) accept faculty members of the Indian Institutes of Information Technology on a sabbatical towork for short period with the industry;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (f) co-create programs  as per the requirements of the industry with the Institution;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (g) provide internship to students of the Indian Institutes of Information Technology;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (h) facilitate for placement of students from the Indian Institutes of Information Technology;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (i) sponsor  their eligible employees for doctorate studies in the Indian Institutes of InformationTechnology; and

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (j) fund and mentor the startups in the Institution.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (7) Every memorandum of understanding or agreement referred to in sub -section ( 5) shall contain —

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (a) the investment proposal of capital in establishment of the Institute and the respective shares asmay be prescribed;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (b) the first Statutes of the Institute;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (c) the commitment of the Central Government, the concerned State Government, and theindustry p artner in ensuring autonomy to the proposed Institute; and

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (d) the conditions, if the industry partners pulls out.CHAPT ER IIIAUTHORITIES OF INDIAN INSTITUTES OF INFORMATION  TECHNOLOGYESTABLISHED IN PUBLIC -PRIVATE PARTNERSHIP

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 12. Visitor. —(1) The President of India shall be the Visitor of every Institute.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (2) The Visitor may appoint one or more persons to review the work and progress of  any Institute andto hold inquiries into the affairs thereof and to report thereon in such manner as the Visitor may direct.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (3) Upon receipt of any such report, the Visitor may take such action and issue such directions ashe considers necessary in respect of any of the matters dealt within the report and the Institute shall bebound to comply with such directions w ithin a reasonable time.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 13. Authorities of Institute.  —The following shall be the authorities of an Institute, namely: —

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (a) Visitor;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (b) Board of Governors;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (c) Senate;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (d) Finance Committee;8

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (e) such other authorities or posts as may be declared by the Statutes to be the authorities of theInstitute.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 14. Board of Governors .—(1) The Board of Governors of each Institute shall be the principal policymaking and executive body of the Institute.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (2) The Bo ard shall consist of the following members, namely: —

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (a) Chairperson, an eminent technologist or industrialist or educationist to be nominated by theVisitor on the recommendation of the Central Government;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (b) one nominee each of the Central Government an d the concerned State Government;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (c) three eminent persons, of which at least one shall be a woman, appointed by the Board out ofindustry, research laboratories, and civil society, one from each category;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (d) two eminent academicians appointed by the Board;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (e) one nominee representing each of the industry partners:Provided that if there are more than two industry partners then the number of representatives ofindustry partners at any time would be limited to two, chosen amongst themselves by rotation everytwo years;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (f) Director of an Indian Institute of Technology or a National Institute of Technology located inthe region, to be nominated by the Board;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (g) two members from the faculty of the Institute, pref erably one Professor and oneAssociate/Assistant Professor, to be nominated by the Senate;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (h) one person from the Scheduled Castes or the Scheduled Tribes distinguished in the field ofeducation or industry or social service or public service, to be nomin ated by the Board, in case any of theabove do not belong to the Scheduled Castes or the Scheduled Tribes; and

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (i) Director of the Institute, ex officio.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (3) Registrar of the concerned Institute shall be the ex officio non-member Secretary of the Board.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (4) The First Board of Governors shall be notified by the Central Government by obtaining nominationsunder sub -section ( 2), other than the members referred to in clauses ( c), (d), (f) and ( h), which shall bedecided in the first meeting of the Board of Gove rnors.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 15. Term of office of , vacancies among and allowances payable to, members of Board. —(1) Saveas otherwise provided in this section, the term of office of the Chairperson or any other member of theBoard, other than an ex officio member, shall be for  a period of three years from the date of nomination.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (2) The term of office of an ex officio member shall continue so long as the member holds the officeby virtue of which he is a member.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (3) A member of the Board, other than an ex officio member, who fa ils to attend three consecutivemeetings of the Board without the leave of absence, shall cease to be a member of the Board.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (4) One-third of the members of the Board shall form a quorum of the Board, provided at least threemembers are from members referred to in clauses other than clauses ( e), (g) and ( i) of sub -section ( 2) ofsection 14.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (5) The members of the Board shall be entitled to such allowances, as may be laid down in Statutes, forattending meetings of the Board or as may be convened by th e Institute.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 16. Resignation of Chairperson. —(1) The Chairperson may, by writing under his hand addressed tothe Visitor, resign his office.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (2) Any member of the Board, except ex officio members, may, by writing under his hand addressedto the Chairperson, resign his office.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 17. Powers and functions of Board.  — (1) Subject to the provisions of this Act, the Board shall beresponsible for the general policy making, superintendence, providing direction and shall have the powerto frame, amend, mod ify or rescind the Statutes and the Ordinances governing the affairs of the Instituteto achieve the objectives specified in section 6.9

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (2) Without prejudice to the provisions of sub -section ( 1), the Board shall have the following powers,namely: —

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (a) to decide questions of policy relating to the Institute;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (b) to establish departments, faculties or schools of studies and initiate programmes or courses ofstudy at the Institute;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (c) to examine and approve the annual budget estimates of the Institute;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (d) to examine and approve the plan for development of the Institute and to identify sources offinance for implementation of the plan;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (e) to create teaching, academic, administrative, technical and other posts and to makeappointments thereto;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (f) to provide  by the Statutes, the qualifications, criteria and processes for appointment to teachingand other posts in the Institute;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (g) to approve fees and other charges payable for pursuit of studies, courses or programmes in theInstitute;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (h) to make Statutes, s ubject to provisions of section 32, governing the administration,management and operations of such Institute;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (i) to grant degrees, diplomas and other academic distinctions or titles, and to institute and awardfellowships, scholarships, prizes and medals ; and

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (j) to exercise such other powers and perform such other duties as may be conferred or imposedby this Act or the Statutes.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (3) The Board may, subject to the provisions of this Act and the Statutes, delegate such powers andfunctions to the Senate or  the Director, as the Board may deem fit.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (4) The Board shall put in place policies to make the Institute self -sustaining within a period of fiveyears.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (5) The Board shall periodically conduct a review of the performance of the Director with specificreference to the leadership in the achievement of the objectives of the Institute.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (6) The Board shall in exercise of the powers and discharge of functions strive to provide autonomyin academic matters to the Senate and departments of faculties or schools, as  the case may be.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (7) Wherein the opinion of the Director or the Chairperson, the situation is so emergent  that animmediate decision needs to be taken in the interest of the Institute, the Chairperson, in consultation withthe Director, may issue such orders as may be necessary, recording in writing the grounds for the opinion:Provided that such orders shall  be submitted for ratification of the Board in the next meeting.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 18. Senate.  — (1) The Senate of every Institute shall consist of the following persons, namely: —

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (a) the Director of the Institute who shall be the ex officio Chairperson of the Senate;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (b) all Deans, ex officio ;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (c) heads of all departments, faculties or schools, ex officio , as the case may be, of the Institute;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (d) all full -time professors other than the Deans or heads of the Departments;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (e) three  persons from amongst educationists of repute or persons from another field related to theactivities of the Institute who are not in service of the Institute, nominated by the Board;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (f) three persons who are not members of teaching staff co -opted by the Senate for theirspecialised knowledge; and

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (g) Registrar of the Institute, ex officio Secretary.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (2) The term of office of members nominated under clauses ( e) and ( f) shall be for a period of twoyears from the date of nomination.10

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (3) The term of office o f an ex officio member shall continue so long as the member holds the officeby virtue of which he is a member.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 19. Powers and functions of Senate. —(1) Subject to the provisions of this Act, the Statutes and theOrdinances, the Senate shall be the princip al academic body of the Institute and shall have the power toenact, amend or modify the Ordinances governing academic matters and the affairs and well -being ofstudents.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (2) Without prejudice to the provisions of sub -section ( 1), the Senate shall have the  following powers,namely: —

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (a) to specify the criteria and procedure for admission to courses or programmes of study offeredby the Institute;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (b) to recommend to the Board creation of teaching and other academic posts, determination ofthe number and emo luments of such posts and defining the duties and conditions of service ofteachers and other academic posts;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (c) to recommend to the Board about starting of new programmes or courses of study;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (d) to specify the broad academic content of programmes  and courses of study and undertakemodifications therein;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (e) to specify the academic calendar and approve grant of degrees, diplomas and other academicdistinctions or titles;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (f) to appoint examiners, moderators, tabulators and such other personnel for differentexaminations;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (g) to recognise diplomas and degrees of Universities and other Institutes and to determineequivalence with the diplomas and degrees of the Institute;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (h) to suggest measures for departmental co -ordination;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (i) to make major recomm endations to the Board of Governors on —

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (A) measures for improvement of standard of teaching, training and research;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (B) institution of chairs, fellowships, s cholarships, studentships, free ships, medals and prizesand other related matters;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (C) establishment or abolition of departments or centres; and

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (D) academic functioning of the Institute, discipline, residence, admissions, examinations,award of fellowships and studentships, freeships, concessions, attendance and other relatedmatters;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (j) to appoint sub -committees to advise on such specific matters as may be referred to by the Boardor by itself;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (k) to consider the recommendations of the sub -committees and to take such action includingmaking of recommendations to the Board as may be requir ed;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (l) to take periodical review of the activities of the departments or centres and to take appropriateaction including making of recommendations to the Board with a view to maintain and improve thestandards of instructions, in the institutions; and

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (m) to exercise such other powers and discharge such other functions as may be assigned to it, byStatutes or otherwise, by the Board.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 20. Finance Committee. —(1) The Finance Committee of each Institute shall consist of the followingpersons, namely: —

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (a) the Chairperson of the Board shall be the ex officio Chairperson of the Committee;11

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (b) one representative of the Government of India, Ministry of Human Resource Development,Department of Higher Education handling the matters relating to finance, ex officio ;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (c) one representative of the State Government in which the Institute is located, ex officio ;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (d) one representative of the industry partners chosen from amongst themselves;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (e) the Director, ex officio ; and

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (f) the officer in -charge of finance and accounts of the Institute, ex officio Secretary.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (2) The members of the Finance Committee other than ex officio members shall hold office for a termof three years.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 21. Powers and functions of Finance Committee. —The Financ e Committee shall examine the accounts,scrutinise proposals for expenditure and financial estimates of the Institute and thereafter submit it to theBoard together with its comments for approval.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 22. Meetings. —(1) The Chairperson shall ordinarily preside over the meetings of the Board, FinanceCommittee and at the convocations of the Institute.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (2) It shall be the duty of the Chairperson to ensure that the decisions taken by the Board areimplemented.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (3) The Chairperson shall exercise such other powers an d perform such other duties as may beassigned to him by this Act or the Statutes.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 23. Director. —(1) The Director shall be the principal executive officer of the Institute and shall beresponsible for implementation of the decisions of the Board and Senate  and for day -to-dayadministration of the Institute.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (2) The Director shall be appointed by the Visitor, on such terms and conditions of service as may belaid down by the Statutes.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (3) The Director shall be appointed out of the panel of names recommended by a search -cum-selection committee consisting of —

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (a) Chairperson of the Board, who shall be the Chairperson of the search -cum-selectioncommittee;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (b) two members, nominated by the Board, from amongst eminent administrators, industrialists,educationists , scientists, technocrats and management specialists;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (c) nominee of the State Government in which the Institute is located;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (d) nominee of one of the industry partners by rotation;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (e) head  of the Bureau, Ministry of Human Resource Development dealing with Indian Institutesof Information Technology —Member Secretary, ex officio ;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (4) The Director shall exercise the powers and perform the duties as may be assigned under this Act orthe Statutes or Ordinances, or as may be delegated by the Board.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (5) The Director shall, except on account of resignation or removal, hold office for a period of fiveyears from the date of assumption of charge as Director.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (6) The Director may, by writing und er his hand addressed to the Chairperson, resign his office.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (7) The Visitor may remov e from office the Director, who —

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (a) has been adjudged as insolvent; or

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (b) has been convicted of an offence which, in the opinion of the Visitor, involves moralturpitud e; or

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (c) has become physically or mentally incapable of acting as a Director; or12

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (d) has acquired such financial or other interest as is likely to affect prejudicially the functions asa Director; or

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (e) has so abused the position or so conducted as to render the continuance in office prejudicial tothe public interest:Provided that the Director shall not be removed from office except by an order made by the Visitor,after an enquiry instituted by the Board,  in which the Director has been informed of the charges and givena reasonable opportunity of being heard in respect of those charges.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (8) The Board shall initiate the process of appointment in respect of any vacancy due to arise for thepost of Director o n completion of tenure before a period of six months from the date of arising of suchvacancy and that the process of appointment shall be completed before such vacancy arises.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (9) Where the post of Director falls vacant on account of any reason other than  completion of tenure,the process of appointment shall be initiated by the Board within one month of such vacancy and processshall be completed as early as possible.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 24. Registrar. —(1) The Registrar of every Institute shall be appoint ed on such terms and  conditionsas may be laid down by the Statutes.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (2) The Registrar shall exercise such powers and perform such duties as may be assigned to him bythe Statutes or by the Director.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (3) The Registrar shall be responsible to the Director for the proper discha rge of his functions.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 25. Review of performance of Institute .—(1) The Institute shall, within five years from thedate of establishment and incorporation under this Act and thereafter at the expiration of every fifthyear, constitute, with the prior approval of the Board, a review committee or shall appoint an agency as athird party to evaluate the performance of the Institute and its achievements with respect to its objectivesduring the said period.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (2) The review committee constituted under sub -section ( 1) shall consist of members  of repute inacademia or industry, from relevant fields of teaching, learning and research in such Institute.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (3) The third party agency appointed under sub -section ( 1) shall have past experience of conductingsuch evalua tions.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (4) The review committee or the third party agency, as the case may be, shall assess the performanceof Institute and shall submit its report with recommendations on —

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (a) the extent of fulfilment of the objects of the Institute mentioned in section 6, as demonstratedby the state of teaching, learning and research, and its contribution to the society;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (b) the promotion of transformational research and its impact on industry and society;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (c) the advancement of fundamental research beyond the current frontiers of knowledge;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (d) the establishment of the Institute as amongst the global leaders in the area of informationtechnology;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (e) such other parameters as the Board may consider necessary and sp ecify.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (5) The Board shall place the report of the review committee or the third party agency  in the publicdomain and on its website and consider the recommendations referred to in sub -section ( 3) and take suchaction as it may deem fit:Provided that the  recommendations of the review committee or the third party agency  along with anexplanatory memorandum on the action taken or proposed to be taken, specifying the reasons thereof,shall be submitted to the Central Government.13CHAPTER IVACCOUNTS AND AUD IT

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 26. Grants by Central Government and State Governments. —(1) For the purposes of enabling theInstitute to discharge their functions efficiently under this Act, the Central Government and the StateGovernment may, after due appropriation made by the Parliament and the concerned State Legislature, asthe case may b e, by law in this behalf, pay to each Institute in every financial year such sums of money insuch manner as is required to fulfil their obligations under section 11.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (2) The Central Government and the concerned State Government shall provide to each Insti tute,grants of such sums of money as are required to meet the expenditure on scholarships or fellowshipsinstituted by it, including scholarships or fellowships for students from socially and educationallybackward classes of citizens enrolled in such Ins titute.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 27. Fund of Institute .—(1) Every Institute shall maintain a Fund to which shall be credited —

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (a) all monies provided by the Central Government or the State Government or industry partner,as the case may be;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (b) all fees and other charges received by the Institute from students;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (c) all monies received by the Institute by way of grants, gifts, donations, benefactions, bequestsor transfers;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (d) all monies received by the Institute from utilisation of intellectual pro perty  arising fromresearch conducted or provision of advisory or consultancy services by it; and

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (e) all monies received by the Institute in any other manner or from any other source.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (2) The Fund of every Institute shall be applied towards meeting the ex penses of the Instituteincluding expenses incurred in the exercise of its powers and discharge of its duties under this Act,furtherance of research in the Institute or in collaboration with other educational institutions or industryand for capital inves tment aimed at the growth and development of the Institute.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (3) All monies credited to the Fund of every Institute shall be deposited in such banks or invested insuch manner as the Institute may, with approval of the Board, decide.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (4) Each Institute shall create a corpus fund for long term sustainability of the Institute, to which shallbe credited such per cent. of the net income of the Institute and donations made specifically towards suchcorpus fund as the Central Government may, in accordance wit h the provisions of the Inco me-tax Act,1961 (43 of 1961) ,  notify:Provided that the Board may also create endowment funds for specific purpose to which donationsmay be specifically made.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 28. Accounts and audit. —(1) Every Institute shall maintain proper accounts and other relevantrecords and prepare annual statement of accounts including the balance sheet in such form and accountingstandard as may be specified by notification, by the Central Government in consultation with theComptroller and Auditor -General of India.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (2) Where the statement of income and expenditure and the balance sheet of the Institute do notcomply with the accounting standards, the Institute shall disclose in its statement of income andexpenditure and balance sheet, the following, namely: —

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (a) the deviation from the accounting standards;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (b) the reasons for such deviation; and

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (c) the financial effect, if any, arising out due to such deviation.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (3) The accounts of every Institute shall be audited by the Comptroller and Auditor -General of India orany other person in accordance with the provisions of the extant rules and any expenditure incurred by audit14team in connection with such audit shall be p ayable by the Institute to the Comptroller and Auditor -Generalof India or such person.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (4) The Comptroller and Auditor -General of India and any person appointed in connection with the auditof the accounts of any Institute shall have the same rights, priv ileges and authority in connection with suchaudit as the Comptroller and Auditor -General of India has in connection with the audit of the Governmentaccounts and, in particular shall have the rights to demand the production of books, accounts, connectedvouchers and other documents and papers and to inspect the offices of the Institute.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (5) The accounts of every Institute as certified by the Comptroller and Auditor -General of India orany other person appointed in this behalf together with the audit report  thereon shall be forwardedannually to the Central Government.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 29. Pension and provident fund. —Every Institute may constitute for the benefit of its employeessuch provident or pension fund or provide such insurance scheme as it may deem fit in such manne r andsubject to such conditions as may be laid down by the Statutes.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 30. Appointments. —All appointments of the staff of every Institute, except that of the Director, shallbe made in accordance with the procedure laid down in the Statutes.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 31. Statu tes.—Subject to the provisions of this Act, the Statutes may provide for all or any of thefollowing matters, namely: —

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (a) the formation of departments of teaching;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (b) the institution of fellowships, scholarships, exhibitions, medals and prizes;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (c) the terms of office and the method of appointment of officers of the Institute;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (d) the qualifications of teachers of the Institute;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (e) the classification, method of appointment and the determination of the terms and conditions ofservice of teachers and oth er staff of the Institute;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (f) the constitution of pension, insurance and provident funds for the benefit of the officers,teachers and other staff of the Institute as per the provisions existing from time to time;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (g) the constitution, powers and duties o f the authorities of the Institute;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (h) the establishment and maintenance of halls and hostels;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (i) the conditions of residence of students of the Institute and the levying of fees for residence inthe halls and hostels and of other charges;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (j) the allowa nces to be paid to the Chairperson and members of the Board;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (k) the authentication of the orders and decisions of the Board;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (l) the meetings of the Board, the Senate, or any committee, the quorum at such meetings and theprocedure to be followed in the c onduct of their business; and

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (m) any other matter as may be considered necessary for the efficient functioning of the Institute.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 32. Statu tes how to be made .—(1) The  first Statute of each Institute shall be framed by the Boardwith the prior approval of the Visitor.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (2) The Board may, from time to time, make new or additional Statutes or may amend or repeal theStatutes.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 33. Ordinance. —Subject to the provisions of thi s Act and the Statutes, the Ordinances of everyInstitute may provide for all or any of the following matters, namely: —

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (a) the admission of the students to the Institute;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (b) the courses of study to be laid down for all degrees and diplomas of the Institu te;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (c) the conditions under which students shall be admitted to the degree or diploma courses and tothe examinations of the Institute, and shall be eligible for degrees and diplomas;15

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (d) the conditions of award of the fellowships, scholarships, exhibitions, medals and prizes;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (e) the conditions and mode of appointment and duties of examining bodies, examiners andmoderators;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (f) the conduct of examinations;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (g) the maintenance of discipline among the students of the Institute; and

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (h) any other matter which by this Act or the Statutes is to be or may be provided for by theOrdinances.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 34. Ordinance how to be made .—(1) Save as otherwise provided in this section, Ordi nances shall bemade by the Senate.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (2) All Ordinances made by the Senate shall have effect from such date as it may direct, but everyOrdinance so made shall be submitted, as soon as may be, to the Board and shall be considered by theBoard at its next me eting.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (3) The Board shall have power by resolution to modify or cancel any such Ordinance and suchOrdinance shall from the date of such resolution stand modified accordingly or cancelled, as the case maybe.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 35. Tribunal of Arbitration. —(1) (a) Any dispute arising out of a contract between an Institute and anyof its employees shall, at the request of the employee concerned or at the instance of the Institute, be referredto a Tribunal of Arbitration consisting of one member appointed by the Institut e, one member nominated bythe employee, and an umpire appointed by the Visitor.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (b) The decision of the Tribunal shall be final and shall not be questioned in any court.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (c) No suit or proceeding shall lie in any court in respect of any matter, which is r equired bysub-section ( 1) to be referred to the Tribunal of Arbitration.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (d) The Tribunal of Arbitration shall have power to regulate its own procedure:Provided that the Tribunal shall have regard to the principles of natural justice while making  suchprocedure.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (e) Nothing in any law for the time being in force relating to arbitration shall apply to arbitrationsunder this section.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (2) Any student or candidate for an examination whose name has been removed from the rolls of theInstitute by the o rders or resolution of the Director of the Institute and who has been debarred fromappearing at the examinations of the Institute for more than one year, may within ten days of the date ofreceipt of such resolution by him, appeal to the Board who may con firm, modify or reverse the decisionof the Director.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (3) Any dispute arising out of any disciplinary action taken by the Institute against a student shall, atthe request of such student, be referred to a Tribunal of Arbitration and the provisions of sub -section ( 1)shall, as far as may be, apply to a reference made under this sub -section.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (4) Every employee or student of the Institute, notwithstanding anything contained in this Act, have aright to appeal within such time as may be laid down by the Statut es, to the Board of Governors againstthe decision of any officer or authority of the Institute, as the case may be, and thereupon the Board mayconfirm, modify or reverse the decision appealed against.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 36. Annual report of Director. —(1) There shall be att ached to every statement of accounts laidbefore the Board of each Institute, a report by its Director, with respect to —

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (a) the state of affairs of such Institute;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (b) the amount, if any, which it proposes to carry forward to any surplus reserves in its balancesheet;16

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (c) the extent to which understatement or overstatement of any surplus of income over expenditure orany shortfall of expenditure over income has been indicat ed in the auditor's report and the reasons for suchunderstatement or overstatement;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (d) the productivity of research projects undertaken by the Institute measured in accordance withsuch norms as may be specified by any statutory regulatory authority;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (e) appointments of the officers and teachers of the Institute;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (f) benchmark and internal standards set by the Institute, including the nature of innovations inteaching, research and application of knowledge.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (2) The Director shall also be bound to give the  complete information and explanation in its report onevery reservation, qualification or adverse remark contained in the auditors' report.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 37. Annual report of each Institute .—(1) The annual report of each Institute shall be prepared underthe direction of the Board, which shall include, among other matters, the steps taken by the Institutetowards the fulfilment of its objects and an outcome based assessment of the research being undertaken insuch Institute, and be submitted to the Board on or before su ch date as may be specified and the Boardshall consider the report in its annual meeting.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (2) The annual report as approved by the Board shall be published and placed on the website of theInstitute.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (3) The Board shall prepare and release for every year a report, in English and in Hindi, the workingof the Institute in the previous year on or before the expiry of nine months from the close of financialyear, and a copy of the same, together with an audited statement of accounts showing the income andexpe nditure for the previous year shall be submitted to the Central Government and the concerned StateGovernment within that stipulated time, and the same may be caused to be laid before each House ofParliament and the concerned State Legislature.CHAPTER VCO-ORDINATION FORUM

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 38.  Co-ordination Forum .—(1) In order that there may be better co -ordination among the Institutes,the Central Government  may, by notification in the Official Gazette, establish, with effect from such dateas may be specified in the notification, a central body to be called the Co -ordination Forum for all theInstitutes specified in column (5) of the Schedule.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (2) The Co -ordination Forum shall consist of the following members, namely: —

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (i) the Minister in -charge of the Ministry or Department of the Central Government havingadministrative control of technical education, ex officio , as Chairperson;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (ii) Secretary to the Govern ment of India, in -charge of the Department of the Central Governmenthaving administrative control of technical education, ex officio ;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (iii) four Secretaries in -charge of department looking after Indian Institutes of InformationTechnology of State Governm ents in which the Institutes are located, to be nominated by theChairperson of the Co -ordination Forum, by rotation for two years, ex officio ;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (iv) four Chairpersons of the Institutes, to be nominated by the Chairperson of the Co -ordinationForum, by rota tion for two years;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (v) the Directors of each of the Institutes, ex officio ;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (vi) four industry partners, to be nominated by the Chairperson of the Co -ordination Forum, notmore than one from any Institute, by rotation every two years;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (vii) three persons of eminence, of which at least one shall be a woman, in academia, industry orpublic service, to be nominated by the Co -ordination Forum; and

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (viii) one representative of All India Council of Technical Education:17Provided that while nominating under clause s (iii), (iv) and ( vi), care shall be taken to ensurerepresentation of as many Institutes as possible by selecting Secretaries of State Governments,Chairpersons of the Institutes, and representatives of industry partners from the Board of differentInstitutes to the extent possible.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (3) An officer of the Department of Higher Education, Government of India, not below the rank ofJoint Secretary, concerned with technical education, ex officio , to act as the Member -Secretary of theCo-ordination Forum.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (4) The Co -ordination Forum may, at its discretion, constitute a Standing Committee of the IndianInstitute of Information Technology Co -ordination Forum (Public -private Partnership) to assist theCo-ordination Forum in discharge of its duties and responsibilities.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (5) The expenditure on the Co -ordination Forum shall be met by the resources pooled by all theInstitutes governed by this Act.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 39. Term of office and allowances payable to members of Co -ordination Forum .—(1) The termof office of a member referred to in clause ( viii) of sub -section ( 2) of section 38 shall be three years fromthe date of nomination.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (2) The term of office of an ex officio member shall continue so long as the member holds the officeby virtue of which he is a member.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (3) While nominating members to the Co -ordination Forum under clauses ( iii), (iv) and ( vi) ofsub-section ( 2) of section 38, the Chairperson of the Co -ordination Forum shall, to the extent possible, ensuremaximum possible representation from each Institute.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (4) The members of the Co -ordination Forum shall be entitled to travelling and such other allowances,as may be prescribed, for attending meetings of the Co -ordination Forum or its Committees thereof.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 40.  Function s and duties of Co -ordination Forum. —(1) The Co -ordination Forum shall facilitatethe sharing of experience, ideas and concerns with a view to enhancing the performance of all theInstitutes.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (2) Without prejudice to the provisions of sub -section ( 1), the C o-ordination Forum shall perform thefollowing functions, namely: —

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (a) advise the Central Government to include a new institution or exclude an existing institutionfrom the Schedule;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (b) deliberate on such matters of common interest to Institutes as may b e referred to it by anyInstitute;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (c) promote necessary co -ordination and co -operation in the working of the Institutes;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (d) recommend to the Central Government, the institution of scholarships including for researchand for the benefit of students belong ing to the Scheduled Castes, the Scheduled Tribes and othersocially and educationally backward classes of citizens; and

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (e) perform such other functions as may be referred to it by the Central Government or any StateGovernment:Provided that nothing in t his section shall derogate the powers and functions vested by law in theBoard or Senate or other authorities of each Institute.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (3) The Chairperson of the Co -ordination Forum shall ordinarily preside at the meetings of theCo-ordination Forum and in the absence, the Secretary to the Government of India, in -charge of theDepartment of the Central Government having administrative control of technical education, shall preside atthe meeting.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (4) The Co -ordination Forum shall meet at least once in every year, or as and when deemednecessary by the Chairperson of the Co -ordination Forum, and follow such procedure in its meetings, asmay be prescribed.18CHAPTER  VI

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 41. Power to make rules. —(1) The Central Government may, after previous publication, bynotification make rules for carrying out the provisions of this Act.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (2) In particular, and without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing power, such rules mayprovide for all or any of the following matters, name ly:—

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (a) the form and manner in which the State Government shall submit proposal to the CentralGovernment under sub -section ( 2) of section 11;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (b) the investment proposal of capital in establishment of the Institute and the respective sharesunder sub -section ( 7) of section 11;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (c) the travelling and other allowances payable to members of the Co -ordination Forum undersub-section ( 4) of section 39;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (d) the procedure to be followed in the meetings of the Co -ordination Forum undersub-section ( 4) of section 40.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 42. Acts and proceedings not to be invalidated by vacancies, etc. —No act of the Co -ordinationForum, or any Institute or Board or Senate or any other body set up under this Act or the Statutes, shall beinvalid merely by reason of —

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (a) any vacancy or defect in the constitution thereof; or

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (b) any irregularity in its procedure not affecting the merits of the case; or

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (c) any defect in the selection, nomination or appointment of a person acting as a member thereof.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 43. Returns and information to be provided to Central Government or State Government. —(1)The Institute shall furnish to the Central Government such returns or other information with respect to itspolicies or activities as the Central Government may, for the purpose of r eporting to Parliament or for themaking of policy, from time to time require.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (2) The Institute, shall furnish to the State Government in which such Institute is located, such returnsor other information with respect to its policies or activities as that  Government may, for the purpose ofreporting to the concerned State Legislature or for the making of policy, from time to time require.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 44. Power of Central Government to issue directions. —The Institute shall carry out such directionsas may be issued to it from time to time by the Central Government for the efficient administration of thisAct.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 45. Institute to be public authority under Right to Information Act .—The provisions of the Rightto Information Act, 2005  (22 of 2005)  shall apply to each Institut e, as if it were a public authority definedin clause ( h) of section 2 of the Right to Information Act, 2005.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: 46. Transitional provisions .—Notwithstanding anything contained in this Act —

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (1) (a) the Board of every Institute functioning as such immediately before the commencement ofthis Act shall continue to function until a new Board is constituted for that Institute under this Act, buton the constitution of a new Board under this Act, the members of the Board holding office before suchcommencement of th is Act shall cease to hold office;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (b) every Senate constituted in relation to every Institute before the commencement of this Act shallbe deemed to be the Senate constituted under this Act until a Senate is constituted under this Act for thatInstitute, but on the constitution of the new Senate under this Act, the members of the Senate holdingoffice before the commencement of this Act shall cease to hold office;

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (c) rules, bye -laws and Ordinances of each existing Institute as in force, immediately, befor e thecommencement of this Act, shall continue to apply in the corresponding institute in so far as they arenot inconsistent with the provisions of this Act, until the first Statutes and Ordinances are made underthis Act;19

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (d) in case there are no such ru les, bye -laws or Ordinances, the Statutes, Ordinances, rules andregulations of one of the existing centrally funded Indian Institutes of Information Technology asadopted by the Board of the concerned Institute, shall apply to the Institute in so far as t hey are notinconsistent with the provisions of the Act until the first Statutes and the Ordinances are made underthis Act.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (2) The Central Government may, without prejudice to the provisions of sub -section ( 1), if itconsiders necessary and expedient to do so, by notification, take such measures which may be necessaryfor the transfer of the existing Institute to the corresponding Institute mentioned under column (5) of theSchedule.

Paragraph Text: 47. Power to remove difficulties. —(1) If any difficulty arises in giving  effect to the provisions of thisAct, the Central Government may, by order published in the Official Gazette, make such provisions or givesuch directions not inconsistent with the provisions of this Act, as appears to it to be necessary or expedientfor removing the difficulty:Provided that no such order shall be made under this section after the expiry of the period of threeyears from the date of commencement of this Act.

Title: SECTIONS
Paragraph Text: (2) Every order made under this section shall be laid, as soon as may be after it  is made, before eachHouse of Parliament.

Paragraph Text: 48. Laying of rules, Statutes, Ordinances and notification. —Every rule, Statute, Ordinance made, andevery notification issued, by the Central Government under this Act, shall be laid, as soon as may be after it i smade or issued, before each House of Parliament, while it is in session, for a total period of thirty days whichmay be comprised in one session or in two or more successive sessions, and if, before the expiry of thesession immediately following the ses sion or the successive sessions aforesaid, both Houses agree in makingany modification in the rule, Statute, Ordinance or notification or both Houses agree that the rule, Statute,Ordinance or notification should not be made or issued, the rule, Statute, Ordinance or notification shallthereafter have effect only in such modified form or be of no effect, as the case may be; so, however, that anysuch modification or annulment shall be without prejudice to the validity of anything previously done underthat rule, Statute, Ordinance or notification.20THE SCHEDULE[See section 4( 1)]Sl.
